kotlin-about-text: Kotlin is a modern, statically-typed, general-purpose programming language developed by JetBrains that is fully interoperable with Java. It is widely used for Android development, server-side applications (including with frameworks like Ktor and Spring Boot), and for cross-platform development using Kotlin Multiplatform to build apps for iOS, desktop, and the web. Kotlin is known for its conciseness, safety features, and blend of object-oriented and functional programming elements
kotlin-proj-omnicalc-text: A multifunctional calculator built with Jetpack Compose. Features include: complex expressions, variables, formula storage, downloadable packages, unit converter, and UI customization
kotlin-proj-ai-text: A lightweight Kotlin desktop app using Swing and Ollama to run a local LLM. Designed as a simple and convenient personal AI tool
typescript-about-text: TypeScript is a high-level programming language that adds static typing with optional type annotations to JavaScript. It is designed for developing large applications. It transpiles to JavaScript. It is developed by Microsoft as free and open-source software released under an Apache License 2.0
typescript-proj-giga-text: Integrated GigaChat into ELMA365 for automated document analysis
python-about-text: Python is a widely used, high-level, general-purpose programming language known for its clear, readable syntax that emphasizes the use of significant indentation. It is popular for both beginners and experts due to its versatility and large ecosystem of libraries and frameworks
python-proj-airsoft-text: A PyQt5 application designed to streamline the organization of airsoft games. Includes player and organizer profiles, team creation and game management
java-about-text: Java is a widely-used, object-oriented programming language and software platform developed by Sun Microsystems (now owned by Oracle). It is known for its "write once, run anywhere" (WORA) principle, which allows compiled Java code (bytecode) to run on any device with a Java Virtual Machine (JVM) installed, regardless of the underlying operating system
java-proj-3d-text: A first-person game written in Java using Swing. Renders 3D graphics on CPU only, without external rendering libraries
